com.taplytics.sdk

Class Taplytics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.taplytics.sdk.Taplytics

  • public class Taplytics
extends java.lang.Object

    Main class for using Taplytics. Call startTaplytics(Context, String) with the main application context and your Taplytics apiKey.

    Once you have started Taplytics, you can run experiments using runCodeExperiment(String, TaplyticsCodeExperimentListener) log events using logEvent(String, Number, JSONObject).

    Taplytics will retrieve experiment configurations from our servers and log event information back to our servers. Your application will require the android permission: android.permission.INTERNET.

    Example Taplytics implementation: 

     
  public class ExampleApplication extends Application {
      @Override
      public void onCreate() {
          super.onCreate();
          Taplytics.startTaplytics(this, "YOUR TAPLYTICS API KEY");
      }
 
      public void runAnExperiment() {
          Taplytics.runCodeExperiment("Code Test", new TaplyticsCodeExperimentListener() {
              @Override
              public void baselineVariation(JSONObject variables) { }
 
              @Override
              public void experimentVariation(String variationName, JSONObject variables) {
                  if (variationName == "Variation 1") { }
                  else if (variationName == "Variation 2") { }
              }
          });
      }
 
      public void somethingAwesomeHappened() {
          Taplytics.logEvent("somethingAwesome", 42, null);
      }
 
      public void loadedUserInfo(User user) {
          try {
              JSONObject attributes = new JSONObject();
              attributes.put("email", "johnDoe@taplytics.com");
              attributes.put("name", "John Doe");
              attributes.put("age", 25);
              attributes.put("gender", "male");
              attributes.put("avatarUrl", "https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/497895869270618112/1zbNvWlD.png");
 
              JSONObject customData = new JSONObject();
              customData.put("paidSubscriber", true);
              customData.put("subscriptionPlan", "yearly");
              attributes.put("customData", customData);
 
              Taplytics.setUserAttributes(attributes);
          } catch (JSONException e) { }
      }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • startTaplytics

        public static void startTaplytics(Context appContext,
                  java.lang.String apiKey)
        Start Taplytics SDK with your associated API Key. Call this method when your Application is created.
        Parameters:
        appContext - application context to track
        apiKey - your Taplytics API Key

      • startTaplytics

        public static void startTaplytics(Context appContext,
                  java.lang.String apiKey,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options)
        Optionally Start Taplytics with your associated API Key and specific options. Call this method in when your Application is created. Options include: - "liveUpdate" true or false. Taplytics will auto-detect an app store or development build, but to force production mode set to false, or true for development mode.
        Parameters:
        appContext - application context to track
        apiKey - your Taplytics API Key
        options - Map of Taplytics start options

      • runCodeExperiment

        public static void runCodeExperiment(java.lang.String experimentName,
                     TaplyticsCodeExperimentListener listener)
        Run a Taplytics code experiment, defined by experimentName. Unless it is the first time the application has been launched the listener will run synchronously. If it is the first time the application has been launched on the device, the listener will not be called until the experiment configuration is loaded from Taplytics's servers. Unless run early in your application's lifecycle, this method should be used for the majority of experiments.

        If you are running an experiment very early in your App's life-cycle you can use runCodeExperimentSync(String, TaplyticsCodeExperimentListener)

        Parameters:
        experimentName - experiment's unique name
        listener - experiment variation listener

      • runCodeExperimentSync

        public static void runCodeExperimentSync(java.lang.String experimentName,
                         TaplyticsCodeExperimentListener listener)
        Run a Taplytics code experiment, defined by experimentName. The listener will always be run synchronously, if the experiment configuration hasn't finished loading from Taplytics's servers yet, the baseline configuration will be shown and baseline variables Map will be null.
        Parameters:
        experimentName - experiment's unique name
        listener - experiment variation listener

      • setUserAttributes

        public static void setUserAttributes(JSONObject attributes)
        Set user attributes for this user, this will allow Taplytics to segment your users based on: gender, age, and any customData that you set. See the Class definition above for an example.
        Parameters:
        attributes - JSONObject of User Attributes, available fields:
        • "email", String, user's unique email address
        • "user_id", String, user's unique user_id
        • "name", String, user's full name
        • "gender", String, user's gender: "male" or "female"
        • "age", Number, user's age
        • "avatarUrl", String, user's avatar URL to be used on the Taplytics website
        • "customData", JSONObject, your custom user data

      • logEvent

        public static void logEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
        Log event to Taplytics that a event has been hit.
        Parameters:
        eventName - experiment event name

      • logEvent

        public static void logEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
            java.lang.Number value,
            JSONObject metaData)
        Log event to Taplytics that an event has been achieved with a Number value, and optional metaData.
        Parameters:
        eventName - experiment event name
        value - event Number value
        metaData - optional metaData JSONObject to segment your results by

      • logRevenue

        public static void logRevenue(java.lang.String eventName,
              java.lang.Number revenue)
        Report revenue to Taplytics
        Parameters:
        eventName - revenue event name
        revenue - revenue Number value

      • logRevenue

        public static void logRevenue(java.lang.String eventName,
              java.lang.Number revenue,
              JSONObject metaData)
        Report revenue to Taplytics with optional metaData
        Parameters:
        eventName - revenue event name
        revenue - revenue Number value
        metaData - optional metaData JSONObject to segment your revenue results by.

        For example you can pass a map with purchase type to Taplytics: 

         
      JSONObject metData = new JSONObject();
      metaData.put("accountType", "proUser");
      Taplytics.logRevenue("inAppPurcahse", 1.0, metaData);
